items.title: 2020 PSL presidential candidate Gloria la Riva made this short...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

2020 PSL presidential candidate Gloria la Riva made this short documentary two years ago featuring heroes from the Rebel Army and other forces that liberated Cuba in 1959.

Gloria asks one man, a member of the Rebel Army, "how do you feel today, 60 years later?"

He answers, "We triumphed, we won. Look at all these boys [motioning to boys watching the parade]. They have a future. Before, they had none. Shining shoes, picking up rocks... Now, they can be a doctor, an engineer. ...That is the satisfaction of us completing our mission."

https://www.youtube.com/watch‚Ä¶

See MoreIn Cuba in January 2019, a Freedom Caravan of Rebel Army combatants commemorated the entry into Havana of Fidel and the rebel army on Jan. 8, 1959, cementing...

items.title: BREAKING ‚Äî CO State Attorney General Phil Weiser has announced...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

BREAKING ‚Äî CO State Attorney General Phil Weiser has announced that the state will open a grand jury investigation into the killing of Elijah McClain.

This would not have happened without the determined struggle of thousands of people demanding justice in Elijah‚Äôs case.

That said, we MUST remain vigilant and be sober about the reality that grand juries are frequently wielded as a tool for elected officials to pass the buck‚Äîand in instances involving the police, that often m...eans shifting responsibility off of themselves for letting the killers off with a slap on the wrist.

We do not know at this point what AG Weiser‚Äôs motivations are and all possibilies are on the table.

The people can say unflinchingly what is required for justice to be served in Elijah‚Äôs case: murder charges for Nathan Woodyard, Randy Roedema, and Jason Rosenblatt. We demand nothing less. #JusticeforElijahMcClain

See More

items.title: SIGN THE PETITION: Step down, Mayor Mike Coffman. "Homeless...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

SIGN THE PETITION: Step down, Mayor Mike Coffman. "Homeless Mike" stunt shows unfitness for public service

Aurora, CO Mayor Mike Coffman disqualified himself as a public servant when he went "undercover" posing as a homeless veteran to launch a demonization campaign against his constituents facing homelessness amidst a deepening housing crisis and deadly pandemic.

His week-long personal experiment apparently led him to dismiss the entire body of serious research on the issue ...of homelessness. He shared his conclusions with CBS 4 Denver: "These encampments are not a product of the economy or COVID. They‚Äôre not a product of rental rates or housing. They are part of a drug culture." When asked if the problem was not about a lack of shelter, Coffman answered, "It really isn‚Äôt. It is a lifestyle choice and it is a very dangerous lifestyle choice.‚Äù

It was apparently lost on Coffman that in posing himself as a homeless veteran, he was leaning on the high rates of homelessness among veterans, a disgraceful reality in the United States where men and women are sent to fight and bleed in wars for profit, then return home to find themselves without adequate jobs, healthcare, mental health treatment, and housing. It is these circumstances‚Äînot personal choice‚Äîwhich explain why veterans make up 11% of homeless adults in the US.

Aurora, like every city and town in the country, is on the verge of a major deepening of the current housing crisis. When the federal moratorium on evictions expires, some 520,000 Coloradans‚Äîmore than 15% of the state population‚Äîmay face eviction. A great number of Mike Coffman's constituents are hovering on the brink of homelessness, and whether they are able to stay in their homes will largely depend on the actions of our government, not on their "choice" between the "lifestyle" of homelessness or security for themselves and their families.

In the face of a deepening housing crisis coinciding with a deadly pandemic, now more than ever we need our leadership to understand the hardships facing their constituents and to fight to alleviate them. Mike Coffman has already demonstrated his determination to do the opposite‚Äîto demonize those who are struggling in order to justify doing nothing in the face of their suffering.

As residents of the Aurora area, we call for Mike Coffman's immediate resignation from Aurora mayor.

https://www.change.org/p/aurora-mayor-mike-coffman-mayor-mi‚Ä¶

See MoreStep down, Mayor Mike Coffman. "Homeless Mike" stunt shows unfitness for public service

change.org

items.title: A truly stunning and grotesque piece of anti-homeless propaganda...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

A truly stunning and grotesque piece of anti-homeless propaganda from Aurora mayor Mike Coffman. We strongly encourage every person in the Aurora area to read this and see the sick campaign the city cooked up‚Äîwe expect to justify future escalated anti-homeless crackdowns.

Mike‚Äôs week-long experiment apparently allowed him to draw conclusions which fly in the face of all serious research on the issue: ‚ÄúThese encampments are not a product of the economy or COVID. They‚Äôre not ...a product of rental rates or housing. They are part of a drug culture,‚Äù says Mike.

‚ÄúThis is not about a lack of shelter?‚Äù

‚ÄúIt really isn‚Äôt. It is a lifestyle choice and it is a very dangerous lifestyle choice.‚Äù

Homelessness is NOT the product of a moral defect‚Äîat least not on the part of the individual. It is the product of a morally deficient SOCIETY that, despite its wealth, allocates the basic necessities of survival based on one‚Äôs ability to pay at a profitable rate. We call for Mike Coffman‚Äôs immediate resignation, as he has demonstrated a total inability to serve this community by launching this vitriolic campaign against his most vulnerable constituents.

See MoreMike Coffman's goal was to find out why the problem of homelessness was growing and what he, as a mayor, could do to address it.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

‚ÄòHomeless Mike‚Äô Aurora Mayor Mike Coffman Goes Undercover To Live On The Streets, Sleep On Sidewalks With The Homeless

Mike Coffman's goal was to find out why the problem of homelessness was growing and what he, as a mayor, could do to address it.Mike Coffman's goal was to find out why the problem of homelessness was growing and what he, as a mayor, could do to address it.

items.title: Truly disgusting. There are, simply put, two sets of laws; one...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Truly disgusting.

There are, simply put, two sets of laws; one for the hired hands of the capitalist state, for whom charges and convictions are so rare that it essentially permits their use of maximum unprovoked violence, and one for the working class, where even the smallest things can get you locked up and the courts are so arrayed that 90% plead guilty.

https://www.nbcnews.com/‚Ä¶/no-charges-filed-against-kenosha-‚Ä¶

Even before announcing his findings, the Kenosha County District Attorney pleaded for peace.

nbcnews.com

No charges filed against Kenosha officers in Jacob Blake shooting

Even before announcing his findings, the Kenosha County District Attorney pleaded for peace.Even before announcing his findings, the Kenosha County District Attorney pleaded for peace.

items.title: One year ago today, following the Pentagon‚Äôs illegal...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

One year ago today, following the Pentagon‚Äôs illegal assassination of Iran‚Äôs top military general, tens of thousands of people in over 70 US cities took to the streets to oppose a new war in the Middle East. Protests continued across the country throughout January as the US lingered on the brink of war.

In 2021 the threat of a new US war remains very real. We must remain ready to mobilize at the drop of a dime and continue to struggle against the US‚Äôs relentless sanctions campaigns which cause daily suffering for millions in Iran, Venezuela, Cuba, North Korea, and beyond.

+7Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Over a thousand people came out in Denver to march against war on Iran today! We demand: U.S. troops out of the Middle East, no sanctions and no war! #NONewWar

items.title: Joel Northam, Lillian House, and Eliza Lucero are slated to go...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Joel Northam, Lillian House, and Eliza Lucero are slated to go to court for their preliminary hearing January 12. They are battling dozens of serious charges that could put them in prison for decades, all for leading peaceful protests that challenged the impunity of the police who killed Elijah McClain.

Sign the petition demanding the Aurora DA's drop all charges in this nakedly political prosecution: pslweb.org/dropthecharges

Donate to their defense fund: pslweb.org/donate4d...enver
OR Venmo: @donate4denver

items.title: While the COVID-19 pandemic forced millions of working class...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

While the COVID-19 pandemic forced millions of working class people in Denver out of work, the City and County of Denver gave Denver Police officers raises in 2022. This will account for approximately 1,450 police officers receiving pay raises.

Since March, over 785,000 people have newly claimed unemployment in Colorado.

The city‚Äôs 2021 budget reveals a lot about the priorities of those in power. Read more: https://www.liberationnews.org/city-of-denver-2021-budget-‚Ä¶/

It‚Äôs staggering to know that even the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression won‚Äôt stop the City of Denver from spending millions on cops. #denver #labor

items.title: 2020 has been a lesson in the profound power of the people in...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

2020 has been a lesson in the profound power of the people in struggle.

In August 2019, when APD murdered Elijah McClain in cold blood, they truly thought they could get away with it with no consequences. Aurora District Attorney Dave Young summarily declined to file any charges against the killer cops. APD didn‚Äôt even take them off the job. The city aided in blocking the McClain family from receiving any remittances. All of this despite the fact that the blatant torture and...

Continue Reading+20

items.title: 40 million people in this country are on the edge of eviction,...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

40 million people in this country are on the edge of eviction, including more than half a million people in Colorado. Right now 15% of children in the state are not eating enough because their family can‚Äôt afford it! Families are having to decide between feeding their children and paying their rent. This is unacceptable!

Yesterday we led a car protest through working class neighborhoods in the city, where so many families are in deep crisis or on the verge of it. Our message ...is that we can and we must demand more from our government!

We call on Governor Polis to immediately institute real housing relief policies to address the severe crisis the people of this state are facing. We demand:

1. Cancel the rents and mortgages.
2. No evictions.
3. No foreclosures.
4. Full housing rights for all undocumented people.
5. Housing for the homeless.

See More+33

items.title: DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER AREA! - HOW YOU CAN HELP

On Sept. 17, police agencies in the Denver area arrested anti-racist organizers in a coordinated assault. People were arrested in a Home Depot parking lot, at their homes, and after they were pulled over while driving. Those arrested were the leaders to demand justice for Elijah McClain, who was brutally murdered by the Aurora Police Department. They are still in jail, with the exception of ...one person. They are facing multiple felony charges and years in prison in an obvious frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain.

Add your name to sign the petition and join the campaign to demand that all the charges be dropped!

Petition text:

"I demand that all charges be dropped on anti-racist organizers in the Denver area. It is an obvious political frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain."

You can also donate for legal and political support for the PSL organizers who were arrested: pslweb.org/donate4denver

If you are a community leader or a member of an organization you can sign our solidarity statement: pslweb.org/denverorgsolidarity

If you can support in person, you can join our emergency demonstration demanding the dropping off all charges: https://facebook.com/events/s/dropthechargesco-march-and-ral/775179416359489/?ti=icl
